name: Trade – World Bank (2016) & OECD Economic Outlook (2007)
title: Trade – World Bank (2016) & OECD Economic Outlook (2007)
description: Food comprises the commodities in SITC sections 0 (food and live animals), 1 (beverages and tobacco), and 4 (animal and vegetable oils and fats) and SITC division 22 (oil seeds, oil nuts, and oil kernels).

sources.name: Food Exports - World Bank (2016)
sources.dataPublisherSource: World Bank staff estimates from the COMTRADE database maintained by the United Nations Statistics Division
sources.additionalInfo: Food comprises the commodities in SITC sections 0 (food and live animals), 1 (beverages and tobacco), and 4 (animal and vegetable oils and fats) and SITC division 22 (oil seeds, oil nuts, and oil kernels).

sources.name: World Bank WDI (Manufacture Exports)
sources.dataPublisherSource: World Bank staff estimates from the Comtrade database maintained by the United Nations Statistics Division.
sources.additionalInfo: Manufactures comprise commodities in SITC sections 5 (chemicals), 6 (basic manufactures), 7 (machinery and transport equipment), and 8 (miscellaneous manufactured)

sources.name: Transaction Costs - OECD Economic Outlook (2007)
sources.dataPublishedBy: OECD Insights - Economic Globalisation: Origins and Consequences
sources.dataPublisherSource: OECD (2007), OECD Economic Outlook, Vol. 2007/1, OECD Publishing.
sources.additionalInfo: Sea fright corresponds to average international freight charges per tonne. Passenger air transport corresponds to average airline revenue per passenger mile until 2000 spliced to US import air passenger fares afterwards. International calls correspond to cost of a three-minute call from New York to London.
